newsitem.title: USA: Internet ad revenues $109.5 mln for Q4 - ad bureau.
newsitem.headline: Internet ad revenues $109.5 mln for Q4 - ad bureau.

text.p: Revenue from Internet advertisements reached $109.5 million in the fourth quarter, bringing the annual total to $267 million, a report by the Internet Advertising Bureau said.
The results were based on data collected directly from more than 200 Internet publishers who sell advertising on the Internet and were administered by Coopers & Lybrand New Media Group.

Total spending on Internet advertisements rose 45 percent in the fourth quarter from the previous quarter's $75.6 million. The first quarter was $29.9 million and the second quarter spending was $51.9 million, the report said.

"The 45 percent quarter-to-quarter increase is a clear indication of the growing role advertising revenue is playing in supporting the Internet as it evolves into a true consumer medium," said Rich LeFurgy, chairman of the ad board.
There are no year-to-year comparisons available at this time.
The report said computer products had the most Internet advertising spending during 1996, followed by consumer products, new media, telecommunications and business services.
The majority of the 1996 revenue transactions was cash-based with barter deals accounting for about three percent of total spending, the report said.
